def_en: You use a few to indicate that you are talking about a small number of people or things. You can also say a very few .

def_cn: (用于形容词和限定词后)几个，少数的
def_en: You use few after adjectives and determiners to indicate that you are talking about a small number of things or people.

def_cn: (前面可用 so，too，very 修饰)极少的,几乎没有
def_en: You use few to indicate that you are talking about a small number of people or things. You can use 'so', 'too', and 'very' in front of few .

def_cn: (尤指享有某种机遇等的)少数派，少数
def_en: The few means a small set of people considered as separate from the majority, especially because they share a particular opportunity or quality that the others do not have.
You use as few as before a number to suggest that it is surprisingly small.
Things that are few and far between are very rare or do not happen very often.

def_cn: 不少,相当多(a good few 主要用于英国英语)
def_en: You use not a few when you are referring to quite a lot of things or people. You can also use a good few in this way, mainly in British English.
If you say that someone has had a few too many or has had a few, you mean that they have drunk too many alcoholic drinks.
You use no fewer than to emphasize that a number is surprisingly large.
